Windows Movie Maker is a video editing software developed by Microsoft. It allows users to create and edit videos with various effects, transitions, and audio options. Since its initial release in 2000, it has been popular among non-professional users who want to create custom videos without spending lots of money.

## Key Features

### Timeline and Storyboard

In Windows Movie Maker, you can choose between a timeline and a storyboard for video editing. The timeline displays the video clips and audio tracks in a linear fashion, allowing you to make precise edits. The storyboard, on the other hand, shows a visual representation of each clip, making it easier to rearrange the video sequence.

### Effects and Transitions

Windows Movie Maker offers a range of built-in effects and transitions that you can apply to your videos. These include color filters, motion effects, and fades. You can also add custom text overlays to your videos.

### Audio Editing

Windows Movie Maker includes audio editing features such as adjusting the volume, fading in/out, and adding music tracks to the video.

### Publishing

Once you have completed your video, you can publish it to several platforms directly from Windows Movie Maker. You can choose to save it to your computer, upload it to YouTube or Vimeo, or burn it to a DVD.

## How to Get Windows Movie Maker

Windows Movie Maker was formerly included as part of the Windows Essentials suite of apps. As of January 10, 2017, Microsoft no longer supports the suite or the Movie Maker app, meaning there will be no more updates or technical support. However, you can still download and install the app from the Microsoft website or a third-party software provider.

## Conclusion

Overall, Windows Movie Maker is a simple and user-friendly video editing software that can be used by anyone. It has basic features that are ideal for beginners, while still allowing for creative freedom. If you're looking to make custom videos without breaking the bank, Windows Movie Maker is a great option.
